results.description: Linfield boss David Healy will study any concrete proposals for a future All-Island League but insists he "loves the league we're in".

results.title: David Healy would study All-Island League plan but 'loves the league we're in'

results.description: We look at five talking points after another busy weekend of Irish Premiership action, including Conor McDermott's magic and Coleraine's impressive firepower.

results.title: Irish Premiership: McDermott magic, steady 'Stute and Currie's Carrick - five things we noticed

results.description: Crusaders miss the chance to move within four points of Irish Premiership leaders Coleraine as they draw 0-0 with Larne at Inver Park.
results.shortTitle: Larne and Crues play out bore draw
results.title: Irish Premiership: Larne and Crusaders play out 0-0 bore draw at Inver Park

results.description: League of Ireland champions Dundalk overpower Linfield to claim a 7-1 aggregate victory and lift the inaugural Champions Cup.
results.shortTitle: Dundalk hit limp Linfield for six
results.title: Champions Cup: Dundalk 6-0 Linfield (7-1 on aggregate)

results.description: Crusaders manager Stephen Baxter says there is no sense of panic among his squad despite the club going four league matches without a win.
results.title: Irish Premiership: 'Things can turn very quickly' - Crusaders manager Baxter

results.description: Linfield boss David Healy says he will be without Shayne Lavery and Joel Cooper for Monday's second leg of the Champions Cup against Dundalk.
results.title: Champions Cup: Linfield's Joel Cooper to miss second leg with nose injury

results.description: Sean Cox's return to Anfield for Liverpool's win over Manchester City on Sunday was a "bittersweet" occasion, his wife Martina says.
results.shortTitle: Cox meets Klopp after Liverpool win
results.title: Sean Cox: Injured Liverpool fan makes first visit to Anfield since attack

results.description: Glentoran's four-match winning run comes to an end as Institute come from behind to secure a 1-1 draw at the Brandywell.
results.title: Institute fight back to grab draw against Glentoran

results.description: Coleraine continue their winning run and stay top of the league with a 4-0 victory over 10-man Glenavon at The Showgrounds.

results.description: Shayne Lavery scores an excellent goal but it's not enough for the win as Linfield and Dundalk draw 1-1 in the Champions Cup first leg at Windsor Park.

results.description: Dundalk midfielder Chris Shields says the Lilywhites are determined to claim the inaugural Unite the Union Champions Cup and has praised the return of a cross-border competition.

results.description: Liverpool fan Sean Cox will return to Anfield for the first time since being seriously injured in an attack outside the ground in April 2018.
